title: Natalie Portman and Benjamin Millepied make joint red carpet appearance for his L.A. Dance Project
text:
Natalie Portman and her choreographer husband Benjamin Millepied were the picture of wedding bliss at his LA Dance Project Gala on Saturday.

The 38-year-old Oscar winner is rarely seen on red carpets with Benjamin, but Saturday night was their second public appearance together this week.

Sweeping her hair back into a tight bun, Natalie slipped into a sleeveless silver gown that featured a see-through tiered skirt.

Power couple: Natalie Portman and her choreographer husband Benjamin Millepied were the picture of wedding bliss at his LA Dance Project Gala on Saturday

The Black Swan star accentuated her screen siren features with makeup and wore a dazzling pair of earrings to the event.

Benjamin, who founded the LA Dance Project in 2012 and has also been director of dance at the Paris Opera Ballet, stuck to simple glamour on Saturday.

The dashing 42-year-old Frenchman wore a black suit with a matching dress shirt and no tie, rounding off the look with black shoes.

He and Natalie, who share eight-year-old son Aleph and two-year-old daughter Amalia, gazed adoringly at each other for the cameras.

Natalie also brought Benjamin to this Monday's Elle Women In Hollywood bash at the Beverly Wilshire Four Seasons Hotel, where she had a speaking gig.

The star-studded guest list at the gala at Hauser & Wirth on Saturday included Groundhog Day star Andie MacDowell.

Andie, whose daughter Margaret Qualley played Broadway dance legend Ann Reinking on FX' Fosse/Verdon, went for a metallic green ensemble.

She teamed a half-sleeved top with a matching skirt that was cut off just above the ankle, allowing her to show off her stylish black stilettos.

The Four Weddings And A Funeral actress, who celebrated her 61st birthday this April, wore her signature wavy brown hair down.

LL Cool J was dapper as ever in a white suit he wore with a matching fedora, a snappy pair of shoes and aviator sunglasses.

Eastbound And Down alumna Ana De La Reguera could be seen modeling a cleavage-baring blazer top with an elegant green and black print skirt.

Meanwhile, photographer Alex Prager threw a sleek black jacket over a flowing blue and white print dress, posing with a hand at her waist.
